body: Here is an interesting point for debate: benefits of (a) drip vs (b) buybacks.
(a) The company pays dividends that are taxed at 25%
created_at: and investors use the remainder to buy N stocks on average that have fallen by x% some time after the ex-div date.

body: (b) The company buys back N stocks on behalf of investors at the market price.
The apparent breakeven point here is when the stock price falls by 25% after the ex-div date. However
created_at: the 25% tax paid is not entirely lost. In both Canada and the US it has value as a tax credit that can be applied to taxable investment returns (the amount will depend on individual circumstances).
